name: SVG favicons
description: Icon used by browsers to identify a webpage or site. While all browsers support the `.ico` format, the SVG format can be preferable to more easily support higher resolutions or larger icons.

links.title: Firefox bug, highlights comment that confirms note #4

notes.general:
Favicon support is a complicated topic. See [this guide](https://dev.to/masakudamatsu/favicon-nightmare-how-to-maintain-sanity-3al7) for more information.

See also [PNG favicons](/link-icon-png).

byNum.1: Does not use favicons at all (but may have alternative for bookmarks, etc.).
byNum.2: Partial support in Firefox before version 41 refers to only loading the SVG favicon the first time, but not [on subsequent loads](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=366324#c14).
byNum.3: Requires the served mime-type to be `image/svg+xml`.
byNum.4: Chromium browsers serve the SVG in [secure static mode](https://svgwg.org/svg2-draft/conform.html#secure-static-mode), but apply SMIL animations using the document start time (0).
